indicators.label: Freshwater Conservation Asset extent
indicators.description: Freshwater Conservation Asset extent includes all freshwater Conservation Assets from the Blueprint v1.3 Conservation Assets dataset.  These include Freshwater Forested Wetlands, Freshwater Non-forested Wetlands, Ponds and Lakes, Rivers and Streams, and Springs.

indicators.label: CLIP v4 natural floodplain priority
indicators.description: This dataset the conservation priority of areas within the 100-year floodplain based on land use intensity and protected areas.  Areas of Conservation Assets within Priority 1-2 were used as input for the Florida Blueprint.

indicators.label: CLIP v4 significant surface waters
indicators.description: This dataset depicts the priority of significant surface waters, based on proximity and drainage into important surface waters such as aquatic preserves, shellfish harvesting areas, seagrass beds, springs, public water supply sources, watersheds important for rare fish species, and other factors.  Areas of Conservation Assets within Priority 1-2 were used as input for the Florida Blueprint; contiguous patches less than 1 acre were removed.

indicators.label: CLIP v4 wetlands
indicators.description: This dataset depicts conservation priorities of wetlands based on the location of wetlands within large intact natural landscapes.  Areas of Conservation Assets within Priority 1-2 were used as input for the Florida Blueprint.

indicators.label: Terrestrial Conservation Asset extent
indicators.description: Terrestrial Conservation Asset extent includes all terrestrial Conservation Assets from the Blueprint v1.3 Conservation Assets dataset.  These include Coastal Uplands, Hardwod Forested Upland, High Pine and Scrub, Pine Flatwoods and Dry Prairie, and Working Lands 1 and 2.

indicators.label: CLIP v4 landscape resource priority
indicators.description: This dataset depicts overall landscape resource priority based on a combination of Landscape Integrity Index and Florida Ecological Greenways Network datasets.  Areas of Conservation Assets within Priority 1-3 were used as input for the Florida Blueprint.

indicators.label: Marine and estuarine Conservation Asset extent

values.label: Not a marine or estuarine Conservation Asset

indicators.description: Marine and Estuarine Conservation Asset extent includes all marine and estuarine Conservation Assets from the Blueprint v1.3 Conservation Assets dataset.  These include Mangrove Swamp and Saltwater Marsh.

indicators.label: CLIP v4 overall priority
indicators.description: The Critical Lands and Waters Identification Project (CLIP) is a collection of spatial data that identify statewide priorities for a broad range of natural resources in Florida.  The CLIP Overall Priority is based on an aggregation of priorities for biodiversity, landscapes, and surface waters.

indicators.label: CLIP v4 rare species habitat conservation priority
indicators.description: This dataset depicts the conservation priority of suitable habitat for one or more species of conservation need based on modeled species habitat.  Areas of Conservation Assets within Priority 1 were used as input for the Florida Blueprint.

indicators.label: CLIP v4 priority natural communities
indicators.description: This dataset depicts natural communities derived from the Florida Fish and Wildlife Conservation Commission's Cooperative Land Cover dataset, prioritized based on global status rank and landscape context.  Areas of Conservation Assets within Priority 1 that were not ponds/ lakes or freshwater non-forested wetlands were used as input for the Florida Blueprint.
